00158 /*_____ M A C R O S ________________________________________________________*/
00159 /* little-big endian management */
00160 #define INTEL_ALIGNMENT     LITTLE_ENDIAN
00161 #define MOTOROLA_ALIGNMENT  BIG_ENDIAN
00162 
00163 // U16/U32 endian handlers
00164 #ifdef LITTLE_ENDIAN     // => 16bit: (LSB,MSB), 32bit: (LSW,MSW) or (LSB0,LSB1,LSB2,LSB3) or (MSB3,MSB2,MSB1,MSB0)
00165 #  define MSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[1])
00166 #  define LSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[0])
00167 #  define MSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[1])
00168 #  define LSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[0])
00169 #  define MSB0(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[3])
00170 #  define MSB1(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[2])
00171 #  define MSB2(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[1])
00172 #  define MSB3(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[0])
00173 #  define LSB0(u32)       MSB3(u32)
00174 #  define LSB1(u32)       MSB2(u32)
00175 #  define LSB2(u32)       MSB1(u32)
00176 #  define LSB3(u32)       MSB0(u32)
00177 #else // BIG_ENDIAN         => 16bit: (MSB,LSB), 32bit: (MSW,LSW) or (LSB3,LSB2,LSB1,LSB0) or (MSB0,MSB1,MSB2,MSB3)
00178 #  define MSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[0])
00179 #  define LSB(u16)        (((U8* )&u16)[1])
00180 #  define MSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[0])
00181 #  define LSW(u32)        (((U16*)&u32)[1])
00182 #  define MSB0(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[0])
00183 #  define MSB1(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[1])
00184 #  define MSB2(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[2])
00185 #  define MSB3(u32)       (((U8* )&u32)[3])
00186 #  define LSB0(u32)       MSB3(u32)
00187 #  define LSB1(u32)       MSB2(u32)
00188 #  define LSB2(u32)       MSB1(u32)
00189 #  define LSB3(u32)       MSB0(u32)
00190 #endif
00191 
00192 // Endian converters
00193 #define Le16(b)                        \
00194    (  ((U16)(     (b) &   0xFF) << 8)  \
00195    |  (     ((U16)(b) & 0xFF00) >> 8)  \
00196    )
00197 #define Le32(b)                             \
00198    (  ((U32)(     (b) &       0xFF) << 24)  \
00199    |  ((U32)((U16)(b) &     0xFF00) <<  8)  \
00200    |  (     ((U32)(b) &   0xFF0000) >>  8)  \
00201    |  (     ((U32)(b) & 0xFF000000) >> 24)  \
00202    )
00203 
00204 // host to network conversion: used for Intel HEX format, TCP/IP, ...
00205 // Convert a 16-bit value from host-byte order to network-byte order
00206 // Standard Unix, POSIX 1003.1g (draft)
00207 
00208 #ifdef LITTLE_ENDIAN
00209 #  define htons(a)    Le16(a)
00210 #define ntohs(a)    htons(a)
00211 #  define htonl(a)    Le32(a)
00212 #define ntohl(a)    htonl(a)
00213 #else
00214 #define htons(a)    (a)
00215 #define ntohs(a)    (a)
00216 #define htonl(a)    (a)
00217 #define ntohl(a)    (a)
00218 #endif
00219

00227 #define TRUE    (1==1)

00241 /* Bit and bytes manipulations */
00242 #define LOW(U16)                ((Uchar)U16)
00243 #define HIGH(U16)               ((Uchar)(U16>>8))
00244 #define TST_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx & mask)
00245 #define SET_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx = (*addrx | mask))
00246 #define CLR_BIT_X(addrx,mask)   (*addrx = (*addrx & ~mask))
00247 #define OUT_X(addrx,value)      (*addrx = value)
00248 #define IN_X(addrx)             (*addrx)
00249 
00250 #  define Max(a, b)            ( (a)>(b) ? (a) : (b) )       // Take the max between a and b
00251 #  define Min(a, b)            ( (a)<(b) ? (a) : (b) )       // Take the min between a and b
00252 
00253 // Align on the upper value <val> on a <n> boundary
00254 // i.e. Upper(0, 4)= 4
00255 //      Upper(1, 4)= 4
00256 //      Upper(2, 4)= 4
00257 //      Upper(3, 4)= 4
00258 //      Upper(4, 4)= 8
00259 //      ../..
00260 #  define Upper(val, n)        ( ((val)+(n)) & ~((n)-1) )
00261 
00262 // Align up <val> on a <n> boundary
00263 // i.e. Align_up(0, 4)= 0
00264 //      Align_up(1, 4)= 4
00265 //      Align_up(2, 4)= 4
00266 //      Align_up(3, 4)= 4
00267 //      Align_up(4, 4)= 4
00268 //      ../..
00269 #  define Align_up(val, n)     ( ((val)+(n)-1) & ~((n)-1) )
00270 
00271 // Align down <val> on a <n> boundary
00272 // i.e. Align_down(0, 4)= 0
00273 //      Align_down(1, 4)= 0
00274 //      Align_down(2, 4)= 0
00275 //      Align_down(3, 4)= 0
00276 //      Align_down(4, 4)= 4
00277 //      ../..
00278 #  define Align_down(val, n)   (  (val)        & ~((n)-1) )
00279 
00280 /*M**************************************************************************
00281 * NAME: Long_call
00282 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00283 * PARAMS:
00284 * addr: address of the routine to call
00285 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00286 * PURPOSE:
00287 * Call the routine at address addr: generate an Assembly LCALL addr opcode.
00288 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00289 * EXAMPLE:
00290 * Long_call(0); // Software reset (if no IT used before)
00291 *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00292 * NOTE:
00293 * May be used as a long jump opcode in some special cases
00294 *****************************************************************************/
00295 #define Long_call(addr)         ((*(void (_ConstType_*)(void))(addr))())
00296 
00297 /* {For Langdoc} */
00298 
00299 /***********************************************************
00300  SET_SFR_BIT macro
00301   parameters
00302     sfr_reg : defined value in include file for sfr register
00303     bit_pos : defined value B_XX in include file for particular
00304               bit of sfr register
00305     bit_val : CLR / SET
00306 ************************************************************/
00307 #define SET_SFR_BIT(sfr_reg, bit_pos, bit_val) { sfr_reg &= ~(1<<(bit_pos)); sfr_reg |= ((bit_val)<<(bit_pos));}
00308 
00309 /***********************************************************
00310  bit_is_clear macro
00311   parameters
00312     PORT     : defined value in include file for sfr register
00313     POSITION : defined value in include file for particular
00314               bit of sfr register
00315   example : if (bit_is_clear(PORTB,PORTB3)) ...
00316 ************************************************************/
00317 #define bit_is_clear(PORT,POSITION) ((PORT & (1<<POSITION)) == 0 )
00318 
00319 /***********************************************************
00320  bit_is_set macro
00321   parameters
00322     PORT     : defined value in include file for sfr register
00323     POSITION : defined value in include file for particular
00324               bit of sfr register
00325   example : if (bit_is_set(PORTB,PORTB3)) ...
00326 ************************************************************/
00327 #define bit_is_set(PORT,POSITION) ((PORT & (1<<POSITION)) != 0 )

00333 #define TID_GUARD(proc) ((__TID__ & 0x7FF0) != ((90 << 8) | ((proc) << 4)))
